meanings.definition: The process of applying a thin layer of gold to a surface.
meanings.sent1: The gilding on the frame of the mirror made it look luxurious.
meanings.sent2: The artist specialized in gilding antique furniture to restore its beauty.
meanings.sent3: The gilding on the cake was so shiny, it almost looked like real gold!
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like gilding on a dark day, brightening everything around her.
meanings.sent5: The gilding on the crown sparkled under the sunlight, catching everyone's eye.

meanings.definition: The act of making something appear more attractive or valuable.
meanings.sent1: The gilding of the presentation made it captivating to the audience.
meanings.sent2: The gilding of the story added a touch of elegance to the narrative.
meanings.sent3: His gilding of the truth made his excuse sound more convincing.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was like gilding, enhancing the warmth of her personality.
meanings.sent5: The gilding of the advertisement made the product seem irresistible to buyers.
